node.title: Theranos and the Logic of Start-up Bets
node.description: In the start-up world, there can be big payoff for investing and little incentive for asking questions.

node.title: Vaccines Alone Won't Stop Omicron COVID Variant, Says WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus
node.description: The health agency leader said vaccines will need to be used alongside masking and other measures, and voiced concerns about booster hoarding.

node.title: Kentucky Tornado Survivor Reunited With Dog She Feared Dead
node.description: Deanna Badillo's home in Mayfield was destroyed in the tornado outbreak that killed at least 88 people.

node.title: Animal Enforcement Officer Jennifer Lynn George Accused of Abandoning Dog, Leaving It to Die
node.description: The woman allegedly left her German shepherd behind after moving to a new residence in December 2020.

node.title: Jim Bob Duggar Loses Arkansas Primary Bid Days After Son Josh Convicted in Porn Case
node.description: "I want to thank those of you who voted for me... and supported me in my race for Arkansas State Senate District 7," Duggar said in a statement.

node.title: Fury As Manager Tells Pregnant Employee to Wait for Cover If She Goes Into Labor at Work
node.description: The woman told a Reddit forum she had been ordered to either wait for cover or contact two superiors to get permission to close the store herself—once customers had left.

node.title: New independent redress system for abuse survivors to be set up
node.description: Public Service Minister Chris Hipkins acknowledges there have been failings in providing redress, and says it's "a national disgrace" that it has taken this long to get to this point.

node.title: Tips for taking the stress out of last-minute flight changes
node.description: Hundreds of flights get canceled last-minute as a result of winter storms and COVID-19. Be prepared.

node.title: Hobby Lobby to pay workers a minimum of $18.50 an hour
node.description: Craft chain's 43,000 employees are getting a big raise next month. Elsewhere, Taco Bell to pay $15 base by mid-2024.

node.title: Meet the couple behind NASCAR driver Kyle Larson's comeback
node.description: Michelle and Anthony Martin co-founded Philadelphia's Urban Youth Racing School, an organization that connects young people of color with the racing industry.

node.title: The Corset Keeps Coming Back
node.description: As we trade sweatpants for formality and fun, corsets are one of the things to reign supreme.

node.title: Raven O, a Nightlife Fixture for Four Decades, Takes a Final Bow
node.description: Since the ’80s, Raven O has choreographed, directed, hosted, danced and sung on many New York stages. After three final shows, he’ll return to Hawaii.

node.title: Review: ‘Messiah’ Brings the New York Philharmonic to Church
node.description: Jeannette Sorrell led superb voices and a stylish orchestra in Handel’s classic of the holiday season at Riverside Church.

node.title: Rams Remind Cardinals There’s Another Team in the N.F.C. West
node.description: Despite missing multiple players to Covid, Los Angeles and its veteran stars knocked off the division leaders.

node.title: Senate Passes $768 Billion Defense Bill, Sending It to Biden
node.description: Lawmakers in both parties linked arms in an overwhelming vote authorizing an increase in the Pentagon’s budget of roughly $24 billion more than President Biden requested.

node.title: On Cruise Ships, Omicron Puts Safety Protocols to the Test
node.description: Many lines are adjusting their masking, testing and vaccine rules, while criticism is mounting about the lack of transparency in reporting positive cases to passengers and crew members.

node.title: College Student Shows 'Luxury' COVID Quarantine in Viral Video
node.description: "[M]y school put me in an old dorm building with 2 other people in the whole building and forgot to bring me food and water for the first day," read one comment.

node.title: NY, California Mask Mandates Not Overreaction to Omicron COVID Variant, Scientists Say
node.description: One of the scientists who first identified Omicron has criticized policy responses, but other researchers have told Newsweek they welcome a cautious approach.

node.title: 2,000-Year-Old Synagogue Found in Supposed Birthplace of Mary Magdalene, Jesus' Follower
node.description: "We can imagine Mary Magdalene coming to the synagogue here... to participate in religious and communal events," said archaeologist Dina Avshalom-Gorni.

node.title: As Biden Threatens Russia Sanctions, Putin Seeks Trade Alliance With China's Xi
node.description: "As the world's second-largest economy, China can definitely help Russia out in the event of U.S. sanctions," Far Eastern Federal University's Artyom Lukin said.

node.title: Delta Prevalence Declines for First Time Since April as Omicron Cases Increase
node.description: The Omicron variant is proving a formidable force and it's possible it could hinder Delta's ability to spread.

node.title: Dog Pals Reunite After 2 Weeks Apart in Heartwarming Viral Video
node.description: "We couldn't go to the same park because Olive knows that's Solo's park," said Olive's owner about the two dog's friendship.

node.title: Internet Slams Mom Refusing To Attend Gender Reveal Party for Daughter's Lizard
node.description: "I don't think I'm the a**hole for not wanting to go to a party for a lizard?" the mom asked.

node.title: Canada Moves To End Ban On Gay Men Donating Blood After 30 Years
node.description: The outright lifetime ban was implemented in 1992 after thousands of Canadians became infected with HIV after being exposed to contaminated blood products.

node.title: Science Teacher John Alvarez Fired for Repeated Refusal to Wear Face Mask
node.description: A school board in Broward County in Florida voted to fire teacher John Alvarez for refusing to wear a mask in school as well as to his own suspension hearing.

node.title: Why Lia Thomas, Transgender Swimmer, is Allowed to Compete in Women's Events
node.description: Thomas is allowed to compete and is following the rules of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA).

node.title: Kids, Ages 9 and 6, Were Possibly Targeted in Deadly Shooting Along With Man: Police
node.description: Police said two armed suspects had approached the vehicle and opened fire "without any apparent warning or provocation" before a third suspect drove them away.

node.title: Newly Approved Eye Drops Could Replace Reading Glasses for 128 Million Americans
node.description: If presbyopia is left uncorrected, a person can experience headaches and eye strain could become more routine, according to ophthalmologists.

node.title: School Board Member Punched in Face During Meeting to Weigh Changing High School Mascot
node.description: The school's mascot was changed from the Tomahawks to the Guardians, but some petitioners say they didn't get enough input because of the pandemic.

node.title: Derek Chauvin pleads guilty ro depriving George Floyd's civil rights during arrest
node.description: The former Minneapolis police officer enters a federal court plea which will likely extend his period in prison beyond 25 years.
